title: How to Draw for Yourself

steps.headline: Keep a notebook, a piece of computer paper, or even a spare scrap of paper on you so you can draw whenever you want to.
steps.description: You can sketch ideas to finish later as full drawings, or just doodle.

steps.headline: Don't care.
steps.description: Realize that what you draw, what you create, is for you. If you want to draw stick figures, draw stick figures. If you want to draw a kitten, draw a kitten. If you want to fiddle with shapes and colors, do that. Your imagination is unlimited so don't stifle yourself just because what you are putting on a sheet isn't the "in" thing or isn't what people expect.

steps.headline: Reserve judgment on your own work, at least until after it is done.
steps.description: Turn off your inner critic while you draw, or at least send him or her on a vacation for a while. Don't reject something before you even begin it.

steps.headline: Remember that there are no right or wrong ways to draw.
steps.description: If your subject looks exactly as you intend, fine. If not, it is simply your interpretation of the subject.

tyn: Pencils, pens, or your favorite drawing tools.
